Home → Events and activities → Get online

Get online

All Suffolk Libraries offer free internet access and informal advice on getting online.

If you have a library card number and a PIN you can book a computer online.

Some libraries offer free one to one computer and internet training:

Filter by library:

Library Activity Day Times
Aldeburgh Library IT help Every day opening hours
Beccles Library Absolute Beginners in computers: book in advance (4 week course) Wednesday 0900-1030
Beccles Library Internet and email sessions for beginners: book in advance (4 week course) Thursday 0900-1030
Beccles Library Job club Wednesday 1300-1500
Beccles Library Tablet and eReader training sessions for beginners: book in advance Tuesday every 2 weeks 0900-1000
Broomhill Library Internet taster sessions for beginners: book in advance Tuesday 1000-1200
Bungay Community Library IT help: drop in for assistance using devices, the internet and email Thursday and Friday 1000-1130
Bury St Edmunds Library Tablet and smartphone help from West Suffolk Sight first Thursday of the month from 5 September 1300-1600
Capel St Mary Library Computer and tablet training sessions for beginners Tuesday 1000-1200
Felixstowe Library Computer course for beginners from Lxpert: £20 for a five-week course (first week free taster) Tuesdays from 23 July 1000-1200
Framlingham Library IT support and troubleshooting. Get help and advice on any aspect of your tablet, laptop or phone. Free but donations appreciated. every other Friday 0930-1300
Gainsborough Community Library Absolute Beginners: book in advance Sessions arranged on a mutually convenient basis N/a
Gainsborough Community Library Internet and mobile phone training sessions for beginners: drop-in Monday every 2 weeks 1030-1200
Glemsford Library Job club drop-in: careers advice and CV writing last Friday of the month 1430-1530
Great Cornard Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Thursday 1700-1800
Great Cornard Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Saturday 1300-1400
Hadleigh Library Computer basics: book in advance Thursday 1515-1615
Hadleigh Library IT buddy: book in advance Wednesday 1000-1100
Halesworth Library One to one sessions for absolute beginners (£15 per hour) Sessions arranged on a mutually convenient basis N/a
Halesworth Library One-to-one IT help for beginners and improvers: £7.50 for half an hour or £15 for an hour Tuesday mornings N/A
Haverhill Library 1:1 IT tutorials on PC or tablets Sessions arranged on a mutually convenient basis N/a
Ipswich County Library Monthly digital skills workshops for absolute beginners and intermediates: £2, book in advance by contacting the library as spaces are limited first Thursday of the month 1400-1530
Kedington Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Tuesday All day
Kesgrave Library IT drop in session: ask staff for help with basic computer tasks third Monday of the month 0930-1200
Kesgrave Library 1:1 IT sessions: contact the library in advance to book a place last Saturday of the month 0930-1200
Kessingland Library Job club and basic IT support: everyone welcome Friday 1330-1530
Lowestoft Library Absolute Beginners 1:1 Sessions arranged on a mutually convenient basis N/a

Southwold Library Internet training sessions for beginners: book in advance Sunday 1300-1600

Stowmarket Library Job club Friday 1000-1200

Wickham Market Library Free IT support, guidance on the internet and troubleshooting hardware and software issues: book in advance Friday 1000-1400
Woodbridge Library Free 1-to-1 computer, laptop, tablet and smartphone help: book in advance Monday 1000-1200
